column4: hi, any recommendations for troubleshooting an issue with listing a directory.  ran fsck on boot and the disk seems to be fine.  but when I ls a particular directory, this happens to be /var/www/  it takes about 30 seconds to a minute to list
how big is it?  large directories on large partions take sometimes take a while.  also, what is the file system?
attempting a du -sch is causing a delay as well,  its larger, but that is in subdirectories, not in the webroot
and the file system is... ext3?
rather, i thought I was,  I will reboot it, cause the logs are littered with iptables stuff.  do you know of another quick way to find out your filesystem type in command line?
it states what is mounted where
how long does it take to display the directory in the file manager (if you have X)
i don't have x, its headless
it seems to only be at this level that the delay has,  but seeing that sudo du -sch took just as long, do you think it could be disk issues?
I don't think so, but it could be possible.  have you done any speed tweaking?
does the disk grind/click while you are using ls?
no, it seems like its not really doing much except its usual minimal hd noise
I don't think it is a hardware problem, but if it is a software one it is beyond me.  Is it for every directory or just in /var?
